resources.string: The Nevado de Santa Isabel is one of the mountains of the Central Cordillera of Colombia. Its summit rises to 4965 meters above sea level, and marks the border between the departments of Risaralda, Tolima and Caldas, being the highest point of the former.1 It has a large number of lagoons, puddles and vegetation of frailejones and other plants. [citation needed] At its top is one of the six currently surviving glacial masses in Colombia, being the penultimate by size in the country just ahead of the Nevado de Tolima glacier.
